clearOwnership.clearOwnershipURL: The solution has a “Copyright (c) Open Contracting Partnership” statement on every page.

openStandards:
The solution is itself an open standard. The schema and codelists are expressed as JSON and CSV.

This continuous integration workflow ensures the schema and codelists adhere to JSON and CSV: https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/blob/HEAD/.github/workflows/lint.yml
bestPractices:
Change management using version control: https://github.com/open-contracting/standard
Open Stand Principles: https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/governance/

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

userContent.contentManagement: Content is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

documentation: The solution is a data standard, expressed as HTML documentation, JSON Schema files and CSV codelist files at https://standard.open-contracting.org

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: The solution is itself a non-proprietary format for expressing information about procurement procedures (“contracting processes”).

name: Open Contracting Data Standard
description: The Open Contracting Data Standard (OCDS), is a free, non-proprietary open data standard for public contracting, implemented by over 30 governments around the world. It is the only international open standard for the publication of information related to the planning, procurement, and implementation of public contracts and has been endorsed by the G20, the G7 and major international organizations.

sdg: SDG8: Decent Work and Economic Growth
SDG16: Peace¸ Justice and Strong Institutions
sdgs.relevance:
OCDS data has been used in support of:
- Increasing the number of patients receiving HIV and hepatitis treatment in Moldova (SDG 3)
- Improving the quality and quantity of school meals for 700,000 school children in Bogota (SDGs 2, 3, 4)
- Reducing the price of 60% of critical medicines in Chile, saving millions (SDG 3)
- Improving the effectiveness of flood prevention infrastructure in Assam (SDGs 11, 13)
- Helping cities go green, like in Mexico (SDGs 9, 11)
- Building trust between government and citizens (SDG 16)
- Empowering women-owned & other small businesses (SDGs 5, 8, 10)

You can see examples on our website at www.open-contracting.org/impact-stories
